Hey there {{NAME}},

We are glad you joined us!

One more step and you are ready,

you just need to click the following link in order to join {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}

Activate your account

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_pending_email.body:
Hey there {{NAME}},

You have requested to change your email address from {{CURRENT_EMAIL}} to {{NEW_EMAIL}}.

Please click on the link below to confirm your new email address.

Confirm email address change

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_lost_password.subject: Reset your password - {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}
user_lost_password.body:
Hey {{NAME}},

This is your reset password link: Reset Password

If you did not request this, you can ignore it!

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_payment.subject: Payment received - {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}

Hey there,

This is a confirmation that your payment has been received by us.

Your account plan is now paid until {{PLAN_EXPIRATION_DATE}}!

You can also check all the payments you made, change your plan or cancel it.

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

Click here to login and accept the invitation.

Click here to register and accept the invitation.

pages.title: Pages
pages.subheader: Here you can find useful page resources depending on your needs.

introduction.p1: These help pages are created to specifically get in more detail of how the website works and how you can benefit from our functions that we provide.
introduction.p2: If you believe that what you read on these help pages is not enough or that you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.

setup.p1: The setup process is very simple and intuitive, here is how to do it.
setup.step1: Make sure you have an account, you are logged in and that your plan is active.
setup.step3: Click the Add Website button and a simple form will appear.
setup.step4: Fill in the Name of your website, a simple identifier for you. It does not matter to us what you write in this box.
setup.step5: Select the protocol that your website uses, http or https. We recommend using https and making sure your website has an SSL Certificate.
setup.step6: Fill in the Website field with your website domain, subdomain or domain path. Ex: domain.com, subdomain.domain.com, domain.com/path.

install.link: How to install %s on your site
install.header: How to install %s on your site
install.p1: The installation process for our script is straight forward as it only requires you to place a simple JavaScript code in your website.
install.p2: Afterwards, with this code, all your website visitors will load the script in the background from your website and give us all the needed details to do our magic and give you the analytics that you need.
install.step1: Make sure you are logged in to your account.
install.step2: Go to your websites list that you added.
install.step3: Click on the Tracking code button and a simple modal will appear.
install.step4: Click on the Copy Pixel button or select and copy the code from the textbox area.
install.step5: Place this code in the header of your website, right before the end of the html tag.

verify.link: Verify the installation on your side
verify.p1: If you want to make sure that you installed the script properly, this is how you do it.
verify.step1: Add the following query to your website link that you installed the script on: pixel_verify. Ex: https://domain.com/?pixel_verify
verify.step2: Access your website with the page with the added query.
verify.step3: If the script was installed successfully, you should see an alert box saying that.

advanced.p1: Some extra thing which may help you with the use of our product.

custom_parameters.p1: If you wish to identify your visitors via custom parameters, then here is how you can do that.
custom_parameters.p2: This feature can be helpful when you have a website that has a membership system where users can log into your website. If they are logged in, you can specify their identifier (ex: email, user_id, name..etc) with our tracking code.
custom_parameters.p3: Why? This becomes very helpful when trying to understand what your users are doing and what problems they encountered on your website.
custom_parameters.p4: You can do this by simply adding data-custom-parameters='{JSON_PARAMETERS_HERE}' like in the following example:
custom_parameters.p5: If that extra parameter is provided then, in the Visitors page you will see the icon near the visitor which tells you that that specific user has been identified with custom parameters.

goals.p1: First of all, you need to understand the concept of a goal. A goal is something that you want to track that the already existing analytics are not trackingâ€”anything from a button click, downloads, specific page view, like a thank-you page after a checkout...etc.

pageview.p1: The pageview goal is the easiest to set up and the conversion of the goal will happen once a visitor reaches a certain specified page.
pageview.p2: A good example would be when you have a 'thank you' page after the conversion happened (newsletter, purchase, form submission...etc) where the user will land on after.

custom.p1: Custom goals will require some extra code implemented to the tracked website, which is specified when you create a new goal from the dashboard.
custom.p2: A custom goal is mainly used for when you want to track a specific event that happens on your website, which can't be tracked with the pageview method.
custom.p3: Some examples of where custom goals will shine are:
custom.li3: Tracking clicks on specific parts of your pages
custom.li4: Any other custom action that javascript can listen to and you want to track
custom.p4: Here is what a javascript snippet would look like for goal tracking:
custom.p5: When this code will trigger inside of your page, the goal conversion will be triggered as well on our side.

privacy.p1: Here all the details you might want to know regarding privacy by using our product.

dnt.p1: Yes, we do honor the Do Not Track (DNT) setting from browsers which support this.
dnt.p2: Do not track is a setting from your browser which, after you enable it, it will tell the sites that you visit that you do not want to be tracked. Unfortunately, it is not very well supported by browsers as of yet but if we receive this header setting from your browser, we are honoring it!
dnt.p3: What if you want to track everyone and skip the DNT setting? It is possible to do that as well if you are a website owner.
dnt.p4: To ignore the DNT and to also track those visitors, simply add data-ignore-dnt="true" like in the following example:

optout.p1: We do take privacy and your privacy seriously and we provide you and your users the ability to opt-out of any website that uses our tracking system.
optout.p2: If you are a website owner that uses our tracking services then, we highly recommend you to provide the following option for your users to be able to opt-out of the tracking.
optout.p3: The opt-out process is straight forward and can be done by simply accessing any website that has our tracking code installed and adding the following query parameter in your browser: ?pixel_optout=true
optout.p4: So if your website is https://domain.com/ and you have our pixel tracking code installed, you and your users can opt-out of the tracking by accessing the following URL https://domain.com/?pixel_optout=true.
optout.p5: By doing this, we set a local storage variable in your browser that tells our pixel tracking code to stop and do not further execute. Clearing your local storage, changing the browser or running the site in incognito will enable tracking again as the Opt-Out variable is not set anymore.

sessions_replays.p1: As you might know, we do provide session recordings and replays. This does not mean that we collect or store sensitive information.
sessions_replays.p2: We do not record any information from any input that is either one of the following types: %s
sessions_replays.p3: We do not record any information from any input that has either one of the following input names: %s

data.p1: We provide analytics for website owners and to provide those analytics we need to collect certain information, here is how we do it.

visitors.p1: In this case we refer to visitors that come in contact with any website that has our pixel tracking code installed.
visitors.li1: When the visitor first enters the website, an Unique identifier (UUID) is generated and assigned to that visitor's browser, including other UUID's generated for that specific visit session and page.
visitors.li2: We do not store information like the IP of the visitor for identification or do any fingerprinting.
visitors.li3: The IP address of the visitor is only used for detecting the country of the visitor and it is never stored in our database.
visitors.li4: Data collection can differ from website to website and their plans as we provide multiple types of analytics for our customers.

tracking.p1: Like we specified above, our services provide multiple forms of tracking for our customers.
tracking.li1: Standard tracking where we only record visitors data, their sessions and their pageviews.
tracking.li2: Visitors Events tracking where we also track events like: mouse clicks, scrolls, browser resizing and form submissions.
tracking.li3: Session Replays where we track almost every event that a visitor makes in order to provide a high quality session replay for the website owner.
tracking.li4: Heatmaps where we generate a snapshot of the tracked page and track events that the visitors are making (such as clicks) to provide a heatmap of the overall usage to the owner of the website.

faq.p1: Some of the most asked questions and their quick answers.
faq.q1: Will the pixel tracking code slow down my website?
faq.a1: No. It does not slow the website at all as the javascript code is running asynchronously and waits for the page to be ready until it executes and starts the tracking process.
faq.q2: Why are some visitors excluded from tracking?
faq.a2: There are some cases where a visitor can be excluded from tracking:
faq.a2li1: Visitor has a browser which has JavaScript disabled
faq.a2li2: Visitor has a browser which has localStorage disabled or not working
faq.a2li3: Visitor has a browser/browser plugin that is blocking tracking
faq.a2li4: Visitor has a opted-out of tracking from your website

index.title: User session analytics
index.subheader: Easy and friendly analytics. Track your users journey, replay sessions, collect heatmaps & more.

analytics.name: Analytics
analytics.subheader: Have you ever felt like you have too much information in front of you and don't know what it means? We are providing you a clean and simple interface with easy to understand analytics.

visitor_behaviour.name: Visitor behaviour
visitor_behaviour.subheader: Understanding your users is key to learning how to improve your website. Check each visitors path and what they are doing on your site without intruding they're privacy.

realtime_data.name: Realtime data
realtime_data.subheader: Curious to see realtime data? You can check and how many users are online, which devices are the most popular and what pages are most accessed.

privacy.name: Privacy
privacy.header: We never sell your data, you own it!
privacy.subheader: Why would you get a service like this compared when Google analytics is available? Because your data matters, we never sell your data and you are in full control of it. You can delete it at any time!

session_recording.name: Session recording
session_recording.subheader: This is simply the best way to see a visitors journey throughout your website. What they click, where they're going and what they like and do not understand. You can easily replay their sessions and see exactly what they did.

heatmaps.name: Heatmaps
heatmaps.subheader: Heatmaps is a very easy to use feature to test out pages on your website and understand which parts are the most used by a collection of users on your website.

testimonials.subheader: Testimonials from people that have used our product.

plan.email_reports_is_enabled_help: Enabling this will give all people having this plan the ability to enable email reports for their websites.
plan.teams_is_enabled_help: Enabling this will give all people having this plan the ability to use the Teams system to create and invite people to their teams.

admin_plan_delete_modal.subheader: By deleting the plan, all the recurring subscriptions of this plan will be cancelled. Users will still have their features they paid for until the Expiration Date of the plan. This action cannot be undone.

update_users_plan_settings.button: Update and update plan subscribers as well
update_users_plan_settings.button_help: By updating the plan subscribers you will overwrite all their current settings with the new settings of this plan.

error_message.disabled_plans: You are not allowed to disable all the plans which are available (Custom plans are not considered if the payment system is disabled).

admin_codes.title: Codes management
admin_codes.subheader_no_data: Create discount codes or fully redeemable codes that you can share to your users.

main.subheader: Generate the code depending on the usage you want from it.
main.plan_id_help: Which plan to make the code available for.
main.days_help: How many days will the plan be available for.
main.discount_help: Choose a discount between 1% and 99% off for the code
main.quantity_help: How many time the code can be used.

admin_code_delete_modal.subheader: By deleting the code the users payment plans will not . This action cannot be undone.

admin_code_update.title: Edit Code
admin_code_update.subheader: Changing the settings will not have any effect on already redeemed or used codes.

admin_taxes.title: Taxes management
admin_taxes.subheader_no_data: Create taxes that you can use and apply to paid plans.

main.subheader: Generate the tax depending on how you need them to be applied on payments.
main.internal_name_help: This name won't be shown to the user.
main.name: Tax name
main.billing_type_help: Select for who you want to apply this tax for.
main.countries_help: Select the countries that you want to apply this tax on. Leave empty if you want the tax to be applied for all countries.

admin_tax_create.title: Create Tax
admin_tax_create.subheader: Once a tax is created, it can't be edited or deleted. After the tax is created, you can associate it with your created Plans.

admin_payment_approve_modal.subheader: If you approve the payment, the plan for the user will start.

info_message.confirm_delete: By deleting this user, everything that is linked to that user will be deleted!

error_message.self_status: You can't change your own status!

display.search_placeholder: Search by username, name or email..

admin_user_delete_modal.subheader: By deleting the user, everything that is linked to the user will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

admin_user_login_modal.subheader: By logging in as another user, you will be logged out of the current account and fully logged in to this user.
admin_user_login_modal.success_message: Successfully logged in as %s! To get out of this account simply use the logout function.

error_message.username_length: Username must be between 3 and 32 characters!
error_message.name_length: Name must be between 3 and 32 characters!
error_message.short_password: Password is too short, you must have at least 6 characters!
error_message.username_characters: You can only use letters, digits and the '.', '_' characters for the username field

main.subheader: Profile details, status and permissions of the account.
main.name: Name
main.type_help: Admin users will have the same privileges as you, be careful!

plan.subheader: Change and update the plan of the user.
plan.plan_expiration_date_invalid: Keep in mind, this plan expiration date is in the past. You can still save it like this, though.

change_password.subheader: Leave it empty if you don't want to change the user's password!

error_message.name_length: Name must be between 3 and 32 characters!
error_message.email_exists: We're sorry, but that email is already used!
error_message.short_password: Your password is too short, you must have at least 6 characters!
error_message.passwords_not_matching: Your entered passwords do not match!

main.name: Name
main.type_help: Admin users will have the same privileges as you, be careful!

info_message.confirm_delete: By deleting this user, everything that is linked to that user will be deleted!

error_message.self_status: You can't change your own status!

admin_website_delete_modal.subheader: By deleting the website, everything that is sub linked to the website will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

admin_settings.title: Website Settings
admin_settings.documentation: Read the Documentation to get more details on certain available configurations.

main.title: Website title
main.default_language_help: To add more languages, please consult the documentation.
main.logo_help: jpg, jpeg, png and svg accepted. Recommended size: Max height of 40px and transparent.
main.favicon_help: jpg, jpeg, png and ico accepted.
main.email_confirmation_help: Send out email confirmation when a user registers or changes his email address.
main.register_is_enabled_help: Allow people to register on your platform or completely disable the register page.
main.default_timezone_help: The default timezone for users when they are registering (they can change it later on).
main.index_url_help: Set the full custom index url ( ex: https://google.com/ ) if you want to completely disable the default landing page of the product. Helpful when you want to have your own landing page. Leave empty to disable.
main.terms_and_conditions_url_help: Link to the terms and conditions of the website. Can be a link created with the Pages creator from the sidebar.
main.privacy_policy_url_help: Link to the privacy policy of the website. Can be a link created with the Pages creator from the sidebar.

payment.is_enabled_help: Disabling the payment system will remove all the options for the users to upgrade their accounts or see any payment related information.
payment.brand_name_help: The brand name will be used for displaying the brand when users purchase via payment gates. (ex: paypal)
payment.currency_help: Currency Code for the payments (ex: USD).
payment.codes_is_enabled_help: Enabling the discount codes system will enable users to add a discount code created from the admin panel, before they checkout.
payment.taxes_and_billing_is_enabled_help: Enabling this feature will require users to fill in their Billing info before checking out and you will also be able to create taxes for each created plan.
payment.offline_payment_instructions_help: Payment instructions for the user to see, before submitting the payment.

business.subheader: These details will be used when generating invoices for the user.
business.invoice_is_enabled_help: This option will determine if users will be able to see invoices for their payments or not.
business.invoice_nr_prefix_help: Your Nr Prefix for all the invoices generated on the system. Ex: INV-
business.name: Name

analytics.sessions_replays_is_enabled_help: Sessions Replays is a more advanced tracking system which tries to track almost everything a user does on a page and visually replay that session to the owner of the site.
analytics.sessions_replays_is_enabled_help2: This feature can be activated but must be carefully used as it may still contain bugs.
analytics.sessions_replays_is_enabled_help3: In certain cases, if the website that is tracked is large and your webhost doesn't allow to post a big amount of data then it could not work properly. Your current POST_MAX_SIZE is: %s.
analytics.sessions_replays_minimum_duration: Minimum duration of a session replay (in seconds)
analytics.sessions_replays_minimum_duration_help: The Cronjob will automatically delete all the sessions replays which do not meet the required duration.
analytics.sessions_replays_minimum_duration_help2: The cron will only delete the replays after 24 hours of user inactivity to make sure the session is not active anymore.
analytics.websites_heatmaps_is_enabled_help: Heatmaps give the user the ability to track specific pages and look for the most used parts of those pages based on data from multiple people.
analytics.pixel_cache_help: Set 0 to disable the cache of the pixel tracking code.
analytics.pixel_exposed_identifier_help: The pixel key is used when telling your users how to customly use your tracking code. An example would be for tracking their goals: your_pixel_exposed_identifier.goal('my-goal');.
analytics.email_reports_is_enabled_help: Enabling the email reports will give your users the ability to get email reports of their website statistics. Make sure to have a proper email sending configuration via the SMTP tab.

captcha.recaptcha_is_enabled_help: When Google Recaptcha is disabled a more basic captcha will be available.

ads.ads_help: These fields accept text, html or javascript.

socials.socials_help: Social links to be displayed in the footer of the website. Enter only the id / name of the page

smtp.host_help: If there are no values entered in this field then the system will try to use the default mail function.
smtp.from_help: The email that the users get the email from / the 'reply-to' email ( registration / email activation / lost password )

custom.head_js_help: Add your own tracking js code ( ex: Google Analytics ).
custom.head_css_help: Add custom CSS in case you want to overwrite certain styles of the website.

email_notifications.emails_help: Emails that will receive a notification when one of the actions from below are performed. Add valid email addresses separated by a comma.
email_notifications.new_user_help: Receive an email when a new users registers to the website.
email_notifications.new_payment_help: Receive an email when a new payment is successfully processed.

cron.url_help: This cron job url contains your key of access also. Only calls with this exact url will work.
cron.reset_date: Last reset date for Monthly Limits of users packages

license.license_help: The license you got from purchasing the product.
license.new_license_help: Leave empty if you don't want to change it. Useful when changing your license or upgrading to a new one (ex: from Regular License to Extended )

button.test_email_help: It will send an email to the value from the From field that you set above. Make sure to first save the settings!

success_message.email: The test email has been sent successfully!

admin_statistics.title: Website Statistics
admin_statistics.subheader: See how your website evolves throughout time.

payments.subheader: This website has generated %s %s revenue on %s sales.
payments.no_payments: There are no recorded payments for this date range.

sessions_events.subheader: Total amount of pageviews generated by visitors on all the tracked websites.

events_children.subheader: Total amount of events that visitors do on all the tracked websites.

goals_conversions.subheader: Total amount of tracked conversions for goals on all the tracked websites.

sessions_replays.subheader: Total amount of sessions replays generated by all the websites.

email_reports.subheader: How many email reports are sent out per day to your users.

notfound.title: Not found
notfound.subheader: The page youâ€™re looking for was not found.

email_reports.title: Summary analytics for %s between %s and %s
email_reports.p1: Here is a short analytics overview of what happened on the %s website.
email_reports.notice: You are getting these emails because you have enabled email reports in your %sWebsite Settings%s page.
